intro: Distictis scabriuscula, commonly known as the rough-leaved distictis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, rough-textured leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
